title: 10 dead , dozens wounded by rocket attack on Golan Heights
message:
Photo by Atef Safadi/EPA-EFEJuly 27 (UPI) -- A rocket attack struck a soccer field in the Israel-controlled Golan Heights, and killed at least 12 children and teens and wounded 29 other people Saturday night.
The rocket attack on the Majdal Shams area occurred several hours after an Israeli airstrike killed three Hezbollah militants in southern Lebanon.
First responders treat a victim after a suspected Hezbollah rocket attack struck a soccer field in the Majdal Shams area of the Golan Heights Saturday evening.
At least 12 were killed and 29 wounded during the rocket attack that struck a soccer field near a playground Saturday evening in the Majdal Shams area of the Golan Heights.
Israel captured the Golan Heights after Syria attacked Israel in 1967 and annexed the area in 1981.

title: Dark anniversary : A look back on the 1996 Centennial Olympic Park bombing
message:
As the world watches the summer Olympic games in Paris, Saturday marks a dark day in not only Olympic history but Atlanta’s as well.
Just six days before the 1996 Olympics games here in Atlanta, construction finally wrapped up on Centennial Olympic Park.
City officials said they wanted to construct a place to unify everyone, and so 21 acres in downtown Atlanta became the centerpiece of the summer games.
“During the Olympics, we investigated 100 bomb threats a day,” said A.D. Frazier, who was the chief operating officer for the Atlanta Committee for the Olympic Games.
Eventually, Rudolph admitted to carrying out the carrying out the deadly bombing, as well as three other attacks in Georgia and Alabama.

TEL AVIV, Israel — A rocket attack Saturday on a soccer field in the Israeli-controlled Golan Heights killed at least 10 people and wounded several others, including children, hours after an Israeli airstrike on south Lebanon killed three members of the militant Hezbollah group.
Hezbollah said it struck a military base in the Golan Heights in retaliation for Israeli attacks on a village in Lebanon.
The Israeli military said one projectile was identified crossing from Lebanon toward the area, adding it was cooperating with the MDA to evacuate the wounded.
Hezbollah said in a statement that its militants firing Katyusha rockets at an Israeli army post in the Golan Heights was in response to Israeli airstrikes on villages in south Lebanon.
Israel captured the Golan Heights from Syria during the 1967 Mideast war and later annexed them in 1981.

title: Irish premier condemns Israeli strike on Gaza school as  inhumane and despicable
message:
Irish premier Simon Harris has condemned an Israeli airstrike attack on a school building in which dozens were killed and injured as “inhumane and despicable”.
At least 30 people sheltering at a girls’ school in Deir Al-Balah were taken to hospital and pronounced dead, after a strike that Israel’s military said targeted Hamas militants’ operations.
In a statement, Taoiseach Simon Harris condemned the attack as “a further demonstration of brutal, unconscionable violence”.
The war began with an assault by Hamas militants on southern Israel on October 7 that killed 1,200 people, most of them civilians, and took about 250 hostages.
About 115 are still in Gaza, about a third of them believed to be dead, according to Israeli authorities.

title: Missile Strike Sparks Concerns That  All - Out  War Is About To Erupt Between Israel And Hezbollah
message:
An apparent Hezbollah-launched strike that hit civilians and children in Israeli-controlled Golan Heights has spiked concerns in the U.S. that Israel and Hezbollah are on the verge of a full-scale war, according to multiple reports.
The latest escalation has raised concerns inside the U.S. that Israel and Hezbollah will break into a major war, according to Axios.
Israel and Hezbollah have been involved in low-level skirmishes with each other for months, as Hezbollah has vowed to support Hamas after the terrorist group attacked Israel last October.
Israeli forces appear to have taken Saturday’s strike as a massive escalation and a step even closer to an “all-out war,” according to Axios’ Barak Ravid.
“We are approaching the moment of an all-out war against Hezbollah and Lebanon,” Israeli Foreign Minister Israel Katz told Ravid.

title: 22 dead in shelling of Sudan besieged El Fasher
message:
Besieging Sudanese paramilitary forces pounded El Fasher on Saturday, witnesses said, killing 22 people in Darfur's last city outside their control, according to a hospital source.
El Fasher has become a key battleground in the 15-month-long war pitting the paramilitary Rapid Support Forces (RSF) against the regular Sudanese army.
El Fasher is the only capital RSF doesn't hold.
Over 300,000 people have fled their homes in El Fasher due to the fighting which started in April, the United Nations said.
Intense fighting for El Fasher erupted on May 10, prompting a siege by the RSF that has trapped hundreds of thousands of civilians.

title: How Russia summer offensive is failing – and what that means for Ukraine
message:
It could have been a war-winning blow.
With Ukraine short of men, ammunition, and trenches, Russia this spring launched its biggest offensive operation since the full-scale invasion began in 2022.
But with around two months of the summer left, it has failed to achieve its most ambitious goals: there has been neither a grand Russian breakthrough nor a general collapse of the Ukrainian front line.
Yet Russian forces continue to advance, sometimes at an alarming pace.
On Wednesday the Ukrainian journalist Yuri Butosov sounded the alarm about a “critical situation” near Pokrovsk, where he said the Russians had managed to take four miles in one week.
event_breakdown: Ukrainian journalist Yuri Butosov on Wednesday reported a rapid Russian advance in the vicinity of Pokrovsk in eastern Ukraine. He wrote that Russia had taken four miles in the area.

title: A rocket hit Israeli - controlled Golan Heights , after Israel struck a Gaza school
message:
TEL AVIV, Israel, and GAZA STRIP — A rocket hit a sports complex filled with children playing soccer in the Israeli-controlled Golan Heights region Saturday afternoon, on the same day that an Israeli strike in Gaza devastated a school building and killed dozens of people.
The Israeli military said its intelligence indicated that Hamas had been using the school compound as a hiding place for assaults on Israeli units.
Numerous steps had been taken, the Israeli military said, to "mitigate the risk of harming civilians."
Israel says Hezbollah, an Iran-backed Lebanese militia, launched around 40 rockets from southern Lebanon toward northern Israel Saturday, with the most of them intercepted and shot down.
The Israeli military says the rocket was launched from a village in southern Lebanon called Chebaa, and apportioned blame for the deaths to Hezbollah.

title: EU top diplomat urges end to  madnes after Gaza school strike
message:
EU foreign affairs chief Josep Borrell on Saturday (27 July) called for a “political solution” to end the “madness” in Gaza after the Hamas-run territory’s health ministry said an Israeli strike on a school had killed 30 people.
The Hamas-run government media office said 15 children and eight women were among those killed in the strike in the central town of Deir Al-Balah.
More than 100 people were wounded, the media office and the Gaza health ministry said.
Only a political solution will end this madness,” Borrell said in a post on X, formerly Twitter.
Hezbollah denied any responsibility for the strike, the deadliest in Israel or Israeli-annexed territory since the start of the conflict in Gaza.

Target Event:
Event: | Update: 2019-07-28T09:53:40.000Z | Description: The European Union’s top foreign policy official said that a political solution was needed to end the Gaza conflict after an Israeli strike on a school killed 30 people, 15 of them children aged 3 to 15.

title: RIMPAC : US Air Force B - 2 bomber used in exercise to sink surface ship with low - cost bomb
message:
Earlier this month, the US and allies practiced taking out a large surface ship with long-range weapons, including, for the first time, a US Air Force B-2 bomber.
It showed the US military can use one of its most survivable weapons platforms, the B-2 Spirit stealth bomber, to sink a major surface ship with a low-cost guided bomb.
The Air Force says its stealthy characteristics allow it to penetrate heavily defended areas and also fly with a small chance of being detected by radar at high altitudes.
Mating it up with relatively cheap and demonstrably effective precision-guided bombs with warheads of up to 2,000 pounds could give the Air Force bombers the “anti-ship lethality” of a submarine-launched torpedo without the liabilities of a submarine, according to a US Air Force website.
The Air Force first tested QUICKSINK in 2022, when an F-15 fighter jet released a GBU-31 Joint Direct Attack Munition (JDAM) that destroyed a full-scale surface target in the Gulf of Mexico, according to an Air Force statement.
event_breakdown: The Air Force tested QUICKSINK in 2022, when an F-15 fighter jet released a GBU-31 Joint Direct Attack Munition (JDAM) that destroyed a full-scale surface target in the Gulf of Mexico.

title: The B - 1B Lancer Cant Win a War Against Father Time
message:
Father time is catching up on the old but legendary B-1B Lancer bomber, currently serving in the U.S. Air Force but slowly headed towards retirement.
Launched at Dyess Air Force Base, these enhancements fall under the BEAST program, reducing crew workloads and enhancing combat focus.
-Initially a Cold War nuclear deterrent, the B-1B has evolved into a versatile conventional bomber, holding nearly 50 world records.
Father Time Is Calling for the B-1B Lancer BomberLate last year, a new B-1B Lancer featuring a range of technological upgrades was launched at the 7th Bomb Wing at Dyess Air Force Base.
Despite its old age, the B-1B Lancer still holds almost 50 world records for payload, speed, range, and climb time in its class.

title: North Korea Kim calls for  people paradise  marking Korean War  Victory Day
message:
North Korean leader Kim Jong Un said it was a sacred mission of the current generation to build a "paradise for the people" based on the ideology defended by a previous generation of victors with their blood as the country marked the Korean War anniversary on July 27.
Mr. Kim visited memorials honouring the veterans of the 1950-53 war on Friday including the Tower of Friendship remembering the Chinese People's Liberation Army soldiers who fought with the North Koreans, KCNA state news agency reported.
North Korea signed an armistice agreement with the United States and China on July 27, 1953 ending the battle in the three-year war.
North Korea calls July 27 "Victory Day" even though the armistice drew a border dividing the Korean peninsula roughly equally in area and restoring balance after the two sides had made major advances back and forth during the war.
Festivities were held throughout North Korea to celebrate the day including banquets, a parade by the revolutionary youth vanguard and a mass dance in Pyongyang's main square attended by patriots under celebratory fireworks, KCNA said.
location: The main event is the mass dance in Pyongyang's main square.
event_breakdown: North Korean state media reported on July 27 that Kim Jong Un watched a demonstration of fire power near the border with South Korea where some South Korean officials were present. He gave a speech calling for the defeat of hostile forces who are hindering the reunification of the Korean peninsula.

message:
Israeli foreign minister says approaching 'moment of an all-out war' against Hezbollah, Axios reportsWorld World Israeli foreign minister says approaching 'moment of an all-out war' against Hezbollah, Axios reportsThe rocket struck a football pitch in Druze village of Majdal Shams in the Israeli-occupied GolanFollow on Updated On: Sun, 28 Jul 2024 09:24:30 PKT(Reuters) – Foreign Minister Israel Katz said Israel was approaching an all-out war against Hezbollah and Lebanon after a rocket attack on a football ground in the Israeli-occupied Golan Heights killed 10 people on Saturday, Axios reported.
"The Hezbollah attack today crossed all red lines, and the response will be accordingly.
We are approaching the moment of an all-out war against Hezbollah and Lebanon," Katz told Axios.
Hezbollah had earlier announced several rocket attacks targeting Israeli military positions.
The Israeli military said its aircraft had targeted a military structure belonging to Hezbollah, after identifying a militant cell entering the building.

title: RIMPAC : US Air Force B - 2 bomber used in exercise to sink surface ship with low - cost bomb
message:
Earlier this month, the US and allies practiced taking out a large surface ship with long-range weapons, including, for the first time, a US Air Force B-2 bomber.
It showed the US military can use one of its most survivable weapons platforms, the B-2 Spirit stealth bomber, to sink a major surface ship with a low-cost guided bomb.
The Air Force says its stealthy characteristics allow it to penetrate heavily defended areas and also fly with a small chance of being detected by radar at high altitudes.
Mating it up with relatively cheap and demonstrably effective precision-guided bombs with warheads of up to 2,000 pounds could give the Air Force bombers the “anti-ship lethality” of a submarine-launched torpedo without the liabilities of a submarine, according to a US Air Force website.
The Air Force first tested QUICKSINK in 2022, when an F-15 fighter jet released a GBU-31 Joint Direct Attack Munition (JDAM) that destroyed a full-scale surface target in the Gulf of Mexico, according to an Air Force statement.
event_breakdown:
Target event - Exercise in the Western Indian Ocean
US service members assigned to the aircraft carrier USS Ronald Reagan participated in a massive military exercise with amphibious assault vehicles, supported by the amphibious dock landing ship USS Ashland, to test their readiness in the Western Indian Ocean on Wednesday. The drills simulated combat scenarios, including amphibious assaults and anti-submarine warfare, a US Marines spokeswoman said.
In addition to the drills, the US Marines also hosted Indian officers and soldiers in Port Blair, in the far-flung Indian island chain in the Bay of Bengal. The British Royal Marines also hosted their counterparts from Sri Lanka for a beach reconnaissance exercise in Thursday's drills. Some 25,000 Indian military personnel are participating in the five-day exercises in the region, which Indian media refer to as "Operation Rough and Tumble."

title: Israel forces advance in south Gaza , more people displaced , residents say
message:
By Nidal al-MughrabiCAIRO (Reuters) - Israeli forces sent tanks deeper into areas in the Gaza Strip's south on Sunday as fighting with Hamas-led militants raged, and Gaza health officials said Israeli military strikes had killed 66 Palestinians across the enclave in the past 24 hours.
Residents said fierce fighting could be heard in eastern areas of Khan Younis where the army was operating.
Tanks also shelled some areas in the central Gaza Strip including Bureij camp, Nuseirat camp and the Juhr El-Deek village.
More than 39,000 Palestinians have been killed in the Israeli offensive in Gaza, according to local health authorities, who do not distinguish between fighters and non-combatants.
About 1,200 people were killed and 250 were taken hostage in the Oct. 7 attack, according to Israeli tallies.

title: Amid rising attacks experts call for reassessment of counter - terror ops in Jammu
message:
Jammu, Jul 28 (PTI) With an uptick in terrorist activities in the otherwise peaceful Jammu region, security experts have suggested a comprehensive reassessment of the existing counterterrorism strategies employed by security forces.
Former Deputy Chief of Army Staff (Strategy) Lt Gen Paramjit Singh Sangha expressed confidence the security forces will learn from their recent mistakes and improve counterinsurgency efforts.
The Jammu region has witnessed a series of violent incidents over the past few week.
Gen (Retd) Hooda advocated for the revival of Village Defence Committees and the recruitment of more Special Police Officers from local communities to enhance counter-terrorism efforts.
Discussing longterm solutions, Gen (Retd) Hooda recalled discussions during his tenure about implementing smart fencing along the borders.
event_breakdown:
J&K: Security experts suggest comprehensive counterterrorism reassessment
To address an uptick in terrorist activities in Jammu, security experts recommended a comprehensive reassessment of existing counterterrorism strategies employed by security forces. Ensuring better counterinsurgency efforts and understanding lessons learned from recent mistakes will contribute to improved safety in the region.

message:
Over 30 Palestinians were killed in an Israeli airstrike on a school in Gaza on 27 July, according to Palestinian health officials.
Located in the central town of Deir Al-Balah, Khadija School was housing displaced people – many of whom were children and women – when it was hit.
Officials reported that 15 children and eight women were among those killed, with more than 100 others wounded.
Israel’s military stated that the airstrike targeted Hamas militants sheltering in the school and claimed steps were taken to minimize civilian casualties.
The Israeli Defense Forces (IDF) did not clarify if any Hamas members were eliminated from the airstrike.

Ukraine may have just scored its longest-range drone strike yet in Russian territory — a Tu-22M3 supersonic bomber around 1,100 miles awayUkraine may have just scored its longest-range drone strike yet in Russian territory — a Tu-22M3 supersonic bomber around 1,100 miles awayUkraine says it struck a Tu-22M3 bomber around 1,100 miles from its border.
This would be Ukraine's deepest strike on Russian territory since the war began.
The Tu-22M3 is a long-range supersonic bomber designed to take out sea- and ground-based targets.
Ukraine said it hit a Tu-22M3 supersonic bomber a record-breaking 1,100 miles from its borders, Ukrainska Pravda reported on Saturday, citing sources in the Defence Intelligence of Ukraine.
But the attack on Olenya, if confirmed, would suggest Russian aircraft are vulnerable even deep inside Russian territory.

title: Lebanese Druze leader warns about Israel attempt to  incite strife
message:
BEIRUTLebanese Druze leader Walid Jumblatt warned Saturday about Israel’s efforts to “incite strife” in the region after it accused Hezbollah of being involved in the shelling of the town of Druze in Majdal Shams in the occupied Golan Heights.
Jumblatt said in light of Hezbollah’s statement denying any involvement in the attack on Druze, “We reiterate our warning and alertness to what the Israeli enemy has long been working on—to incite strife, fragment the region, and target its components,” as reported by Lebanon’s National News Agency.
“We have previously thwarted this (Israeli) scheme, and now that it has reemerged, we remain vigilant alongside the resistance and all fighters confronting Israeli aggression and occupation.”Israeli authorities said earlier that 11 people were killed and 37 others injured in the missile attack.
While the Israeli army accused Hezbollah of the attack, the group denied responsibility.
Tensions have risen along Lebanon's border with Israel amid cross-border attacks between Hezbollah and Israeli forces as Tel Aviv presses ahead with a deadly offensive on the Gaza Strip, which has killed nearly 39,300 victims since October following an attack by the Palestinian resistance group, Hamas*Writing by Rania Abu Shamala
event_breakdown:
Location: Golan Heights
Reported Event: Lebanese Druze leader Walid Jumblatt warned about Israel's efforts to "incite strife" in the region after it accused Hezbollah of being involved in the shelling of the town of Druze in Majdal Shams in the occupied Golan Heights.

title: Netanyahu says Hezbollah will pay  heavy price  after Golan strike kills 11
message:
Israeli prime minister Benjamin Netanyahu warned that Hezbollah “will pay a heavy price for this attack, one that it has not paid so far,” his office said after a rocket strike on a football field killed at least 11 children and teenagers.
The Israeli military’s chief spokesman, Rear Admiral Daniel Hagari, called it the deadliest attack on Israeli civilians since the Hamas attack on October 7th that sparked the war in Gaza.
The strike followed earlier cross-border violence on Saturday, when Hezbollah said three of its fighters were killed, without specifying where.
Ha’il Mahmoud, a resident of Majdal Shams, told Channel 12 that children were playing football when the rocket hit the field.
Israel and Hezbollah have been trading fire since October 8, a day after Hamas militants stormed into southern Israel.

title: Israeli airstrike on school in central Gaza leaves at least 30 dead
message:
Israeli airstrike on school in central Gaza leaves at least 30 deadIran Press TVSaturday, 27 July 2024 2:05 PMAt least 30 Palestinians have been killed in an Israeli strike on a school sheltering displaced people in the city of Deir al-Balah in the central part of the Gaza Strip.
Gaza's Health Ministry and the Government Media Office in the besieged enclave said on Saturday that the attack on Khadija school west of Deir al-Balah also wounded more than 100 people.
In a statement, the Palestinian resistance movement Hamas condemned the attack on Khadija school.
The "massacre at Khadija School is a crime that confirms the Israeli enemy's estrangement from all human values ​​and its defiance of all laws of war," Hamas said.
The resistance group also noted that the occupying regime continues "to commit massacres against civilians without any deterrence and with criminal cover" provided by the United States.

title: Rocket kills 11 in Israeli - controlled Golan heights
message:
A rocket fired from Lebanon hit a football pitch in an Arab town in the Israeli-annexed Golan Heights Saturday, killing 11 youngsters in what the army described as the “deadliest attack on Israeli civilians since October 7”.
The army said Lebanese militant group Hezbollah fired the deadly rocket that killed the youngsters aged between 10 and 20 years when they were hit on the pitch in the town of Majdal Shams.
The rocket fire came after an Israeli strike killed four Hezbollah fighters in south Lebanon prompting the Iran-backed militant group to announce a flurry of retaliatory rocket attacks against the Golan and northern Israel.
Military spokesman Daniel Hagari said on X that 11 youngsters were killed in the attack, while the emergency service Magen David Adom said 19 others were wounded when the rocket hit Majdal Shams.
The police and the army said the rocket fired at Majdal Shams was part of a barrage of rockets fired from Lebanon which struck multiple locations in the Golan.
event_breakdown: Israeli army says 11 Israeli civilians are killed in a series of rocket attacks launched from Lebanon

title: US says it has practiced using a low - cost bomb to sink a major surface ship
message:
Earlier this month, the US and allies practiced taking out a large surface ship with long-range weapons, including, for the first time, a US Air Force B-2 bomber.
The Air Force says its stealthy characteristics allow it to penetrate heavily defended areas and also fly with a small chance of being detected by radar at high altitudes.
Mating it up with relatively cheap and demonstrably effective precision-guided bombs with warheads of up to 907kg could give the Air Force bombers the "anti-ship lethality" of a submarine-launched torpedo without the liabilities of a submarine, according to a US Air Force website.
The Air Force first tested QUICKSINK in 2022, when an F-15 fighter jet released a GBU-31 Joint Direct Attack Munition (JDAM) that destroyed a full-scale surface target in the Gulf of Mexico, according to an Air Force statement.
"Multi-domain strike capabilities including Naval Strike Missile are foundational to deterring any potential adversary's attempts to project power against Australia," he said.

title: Rebels in Mali claim to have killed and injured dozens of soldiers , Russian mercenaries
message:
Rebels in Mali claim to have killed and injured dozens of soldiers, Russian mercenariesMali’s army and Russian mercenaries from the Wagner Group lost dozens in killed and wounded in a battle with rebels in the country’s north, a spokesman for the rebels claimed on July 27.
The West African nation of Mali has been the subject of a significant Russian influence campaign since the Malian army overthrew the government in a coup in 2021.
Russian pro-war Telegram channels, including those linked to the Wagner Group, published photos and videos allegedly showing the bodies of killed mercenaries and destroyed equipment.
Wagner mercenaries fought in Ukraine and launched a brief rebellion against the Kremlin in June 2023, marching on Moscow before abruptly ending their mutiny.
After the failed rebellion, some Wagner members signed contracts with the Russian Defense Ministry, others went to fight in Africa.

title: Adopt radical approach in addressing crime
message:
The appointment of Port of Spain South MP Keith Scotland as a minister in the national security ministry inevitably drew mocking comments on social media about bikes and coal pots.
After all, until this elevation, Mr Scotland was best known for his ­ill-advised proposal in his 2022 budget contribution, when he suggested citizens who weren’t able to afford gas could cook with coal pots and ride bikes instead of driving.
If, however, he can help reduce crime and fix the problems in the police force in the coming months, he might silence his critics.

title: Sunday book pick : Shakespeare in Palestine in Isabella Hammad  Enter Ghost
message:
“Even if I cannot live in it, my soul will reawaken if there is a Palestine state.”The Israeli war on Palestine – the occupation, the genocide – did not start on October 7, 2023.
When childhood memories are recalled, it’s not unusual to remember names that have died, gone missing, or fled Palestine.
Thus begins Isabella Hammad’s novel, Enter Ghost.
As she reluctantly agrees to practice with the troupe, she realises staging a play in Palestine is far more than just being good at your job.
In Palestine, all land is territory – enemy territory, occupied territory, unknown territory.

title: Parliament approves 2 - year military deployment in Somalia
message:
Parliament approves 2-year military deployment in SomaliaANKARAThe Turkish parliament has approved a Presidential motion to deploy the military in Somalia for two years to support security against terrorism and other threats under the Türkiye-Somalia defense cooperation agreement.
The mandate was most recently extended by the Turkish parliament on Jan. 17 for another year.
It stressed that despite having adequate personnel and resources, Somali defense and security forces have not reached the desired level due to economic challenges.
The Somali government wants to control maritime areas and integrate resources into the economy to enhance the capacity of its security forces and other state institutions.
The goal aligns with the Somali Security Sector Development Plan, which was adopted at the Somalia Security Conference co-hosted by Türkiye in New York on Dec. 12, 2023, and aims for Somalia to take full responsibility for its security in the near future.

title: GoFundMe launched for Marisa Galloway after murder - suicide
message:
The grieving loved ones of a mom of two shot dead by her ex-mother-in-law launched a GoFundMe page Saturday to help her orphaned daughters.
The “Honor Marisa Galloway: Support Her Legacy” effort raised about $10,000 of its $50,000 goal within the first four hours of its launch.
4 Marisa Galloway was killed Friday after she was shot dead by her ex-mother-in-law, who then turned the gun on herself.
4 Galloway was a former volunteer coach at Fordham University and a board member of the Central Park Track Club.
Courtesy of Central Park Track Club4 Galloway and her ex were in the midst of a bitter custody battle over their toddler daughter.
location: The shooting occurred at Marisa Galloway's house in Westchester County, New York.
event_breakdown:
On Saturday, a family launched a GoFundMe page to support two orphaned daughters of a woman fatally shot by her ex-mother-in-law this week in New York City.
The money raised by the “Honor Marisa Galloway: Support Her Legacy” effort will help Marisa Galloway’s two-year-old twins “access extracurricular activities and educational opportunities,”according to the page.
The fund-raising push follows Friday’s tragedy, when Galloway, a former volunteer coach at Fordham University and a board member of the Central Park Track Club, was killed after her ex-mother-in-law, aged 70, shot her outside an East Harlem school before killing herself.
Investigators are continuing to look into what led up to the violence, which erupted during a bitter custody battle over Galloway’s toddler daughter.

title: Thousands in Ukraine honor soldiers killed in blast and urge government to get prisoners freed
message:
Several thousand soldiers and civilians gathered at Kyiv’s Independence Square Sunday to commemorate the second anniversary of an explosion that killed more than 50 Ukrainians Russia held in the Olenivka prison barracks.
Speakers at the solemn ceremony urged the Ukrainian government to work harder to get the soldiers freed in a prisoner exchange.
The Olenivka explosion was one of the most painful pages in the war, according to many soldiers.
They must know that we have done everything we can do to get them released.”Russia has claimed that the Olenivka explosion was caused by Ukrainian forces firing a missile that hit the prison barracks.
Many were also pressing for the release of Ukrainian soldiers who were defending the Avovstal steel works and were captured when Mariupol fell in 2022.

title: Mourners heckle Israeli ministers at funerals of 12 children killed by Hezbollah rockets
message:
Israeli ministers were met with jeers and heckles at the funerals of 12 children killed in a suspected Hezbollah rocket attack on Saturday.
Israel and the US pointed the finger at Hezbollah, which has been trading near daily fire with Israeli soldiers since Oct 7, an accusation Hezbollah denies.
On Sunday, thousands of mourners who were at the funeral in northern Israel’s Majdal Shams condemned the arrival of government ministers, whom they had told to stay away.
They accuse them of having long abandoned their community and were only going to the funeral to exploit it for political gain.
Nir Barkat, housing minister, Idit Silman, environmental protection minister, and Bezalel Smotrich, the controversial Right-wing finance minister, were subjected to abuse and jeers as they arrived.

title: Saudi Arabia Urges Yemen to Help De - Escalate Tensions With Houthis
message:
Saudi Arabia is increasingly anxious over the situation in neighboring Yemen, where Iran-backed Houthi militants have stepped up hostilities with Israel and threatened to attack the oil-rich kingdom over claims it’s waging economic warfare against them.
Riyadh fears being drawn into a new direct conflict with the Houthis, according to several people familiar with the Saudi government’s strategy, who asked not to be identified due to the sensitivity of the matter.
Saudi Arabia previously fought the militant group for seven years from 2015 in a conflict that devastated Yemen, leaving an estimated 370,000 people dead from fighting and famine.

title: Hezbollah : Origins , Influence , and Controversies
message:
Initially formed to combat Israeli forces, it has grown into a formidable military power, retaining its arsenal even after the war.
The group's influence spans across the Middle East, aligning with Iranian interests and supporting other militant groups.
Hezbollah's involvement in the ongoing Gaza conflict, marked by daily exchanges of fire with Israeli forces, underscores its significant military capabilities.
Despite its military prowess, Hezbollah faces allegations of attacks, which it vehemently denies.
Its political power has fluctuated over the years, yet it continues to wield considerable influence in the Lebanese government.

title: What is Hezbollah in Lebanon and will it go to war with Israel ?
message:
What is Hezbollah in Lebanon and will it go to war with Israel?
When Israel withdrew from Lebanon in 2000, Hezbollah took credit for pushing them out.
In 2006, a full-blown war broke out between Hezbollah and Israel, triggered when Hezbollah carried out a deadly cross-border raid.
Could Hezbollah go to war with Israel?
The Israel Defense Forces (IDF) have retaliated, using air strikes, and tank and artillery fire against Hezbollah positions in Lebanon.

title: Russian President Vladimir Putin greets INS Tabar on Russia Navy Day
message:
Russian President Vladimir Putin greeted Indian Navy personnel onboard Indian Naval Ship (INS) Tabar, which is participating in Russia's Navy Day celebrations, Russia-based RT reported.
Putin reviewed the Main Naval Parade on the Neva River in St Petersburg.
This year, Russia's Main Naval Parade on the Neva River involves 20 surface ships and gunboats, four sailing vessels and a submarine, according to TASS report.
Nearly 2,500 troops marched in foot columns on Senate Square in St Petersburg to conclude Russia's Main Naval Parade.
Earlier in the day, INS Tabar arrived at St Petersburg to participate in Russian Navy Day celebrations.

title: 13 alliances of the modern world : who in them and what do they do ?
message:
A new regional military alliance in the Middle East may be in the offing if Israel's prime minister gets his way.
Five Eyes: The oldest actively functioning modern multilateral alliance in the world.
The alliance’s modern role includes the monitoring, surveillance and sharing of communications worldwide, including of member countries’ own citizens.
Bolivia, Cuba, Ecuador, Mexico, Nicaragua, Uruguay and Venezuela have quit and denounced the treaty, leaving the so-called “hemispheric defense” pact full of gaps.
Nordic Defense Cooperation: A defense cooperation pact formed in 2009 consisting of Denmark, Finland, Iceland, Norway and Sweden, ostensibly designed to strengthen member states’ defense capabilities.

title: The US says it has successfully practiced using a low - cost bomb to sink a major surface ship . China is taking note
message:
Earlier this month, the US and allies practiced taking out a large surface ship with long-range weapons, including, for the first time, a US Air Force B-2 bomber.
It showed the US military can use one of its most survivable weapons platforms, the B-2 Spirit stealth bomber, to sink a major surface ship with a low-cost guided bomb.
The Air Force says its stealthy characteristics allow it to penetrate heavily defended areas and also fly with a small chance of being detected by radar at high altitudes.
Mating it up with relatively cheap and demonstrably effective precision-guided bombs with warheads of up to 2,000 pounds could give the Air Force bombers the “anti-ship lethality” of a submarine-launched torpedo without the liabilities of a submarine, according to a US Air Force website.
The Air Force first tested QUICKSINK in 2022, when an F-15 fighter jet released a GBU-31 Joint Direct Attack Munition (JDAM) that destroyed a full-scale surface target in the Gulf of Mexico, according to an Air Force statement.
location: The location provided in this text is Gulf of Mexico.
event_breakdown: US Air Force B-2 bomber practices sinking an Arleigh Burke-class destroyer near Guam.
